Author: sharp11flat13

Comment: >There's plenty of blame to go around. The media, a failing educational system, a decline in values and critical thinking skills, the list goes on. If you go back far enough, Reagan is the one that set all of this in motion.  I agree entirely. And actually I think it can be argued that it goes back much further than that, or Reagan would never have been elected.  In a democracy, the government is a reflection of the culture and I believe America has some soul-searching to do. The cultural problems you face are common to all modern industrialized democracies, but they seem to be on steroids in the US and to fix them you’re going to have to understand why that is.  So I think the US is at a turning point, and it will be up to its citizens whether it engages in self-reflection or digs in its heels.  Best of luck to you.
Author: sharp11flat13
